metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13694 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 77.0.3865.120 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13694` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
